intro: Ervatamia makateaensis, commonly known as the Makatea ervatamia, is a flowering plant native to the island of Makatea in French Polynesia. It belongs to the family Amaranthaceae and is characterized by its slender, branching stems and small, greenish-white flowers. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and is adapted to the tropical climate with high humidity and saline conditions. Its leaves are alternate and lance-shaped, often covered in a fine layer of hairs. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
